Title: FRI-MON, 8/1-4: SKINT WEEKEND

Content:
FRI-MON, 8/1-4: SKINT WEEKEND
cultural fests / street fairs / food events / markets / shopping events
(free admission, unless noted otherwise):
► sat 11am-6pm:
smorgasburg x suntory present: japan meets brooklyn – matsuri
: smorgasburg (williamsburg).
>>
► sat 3-9pm:
jersey city night market
: city hall ancillary lot. free admission (pay-as-you-go).
>>
► sat 3:30-7pm:
brooklyn art meetup
: maria hernandez park (bushwick).
>>
► sun 12-7pm (rain date: 8/9):
third annual summer blockfest hip-hop festival + community celebration
: 770 jackson street, hoboken.
>>
► sun 1-7pm:
phoenicia flea at strong rope brewery
: red hook.
>>
sponsored
image by Jen Chou
The Chain Theatre is thrilled to announce the
2025 Chain NYC Film Festival
. A cinematic celebration of bold voices and original storytelling, this year’s festival features
over 160 films
from around the globe—narratives, documentaries, shorts, web series, and animated works—plus panels, filmmaker events, and an awards ceremony.
Special Events Include:
•
The Usual Rejects: a DEMOLITION MAN fan event
on August 8 & 9 | 7:30 pm
A staged parody event with trivia, prizes, audience participation, and drinking games. From the team behind sold-out spoofs of
Titanic, TMNT
, and
Star Wars
. Tickets include a complimentary drink!
•
Industry Panel with Geoffrey Cantor
on Sunday, August 17 | 2PM
Join
Geoffrey Cantor
(
Daredevil, The Punisher
) for a candid discussion on career longevity and indie film survival. Tickets are Free. Reservations required.
Past guests have included
Oscar-winning writers, Emmy-nominated creators
, and industry legends like
Richard LaGravenese
and
Richard Price
. The 2025 festival continues this legacy of discovery and excellence. Chain Theatre’s past collaborators include
Eric Bogosian, Jesse Eisenberg
, and
John Patrick Shanley
sharing new work with Off-Broadway audiences.
2025 Chain NYC Film Festival
AUGUST 7-17
The Chain Theatre
312 W 36 Street, 3rd & 4th Floor (Between 8th and 9th ave)
All screenings are $13 in advance and $15 at the door
MORE INFO AND TICKETS
friday
thru the season:
rooftop cinema club
: take your movie night to new heights at rooftop cinema club, the annual open-air movie series held at the third floor skylawn rooftop of the embassy suites hotel in midtown. catch cult favorites, classics, and newer releases all season long, with provided wireless headphones to help block out the city buzz. soda, beer, wine, cocktails, popcorn, candy, hot dogs, pretzels, nachos, pizza, and more are available for purchase to make it a full night out. this month’s screenings include
american psycho, before sunrise, camp beverly hills, clueless, dirty dancing, do the right thing, friday the 13th, grease, sinners, stand by me, taxi driver, twilight, when harry met sally
, and many more. $12-29 admission (15% off for military, 10% off for students).
>>
thru september:
rooftop movies at yotel times square
: take in a flick on the rooftop terrace of the green room 42 at yotel times square. food and drinks will be available for purchase. this month’s selections include
birds of prey, ferris bueller’s day off, titanic
, and more. $21+.
>>
thru 8/31:
snl
ticket lottery
: want to see
saturday night live
live? the show’s free ticket lottery opens 8/1 and runs through the end of the month for a chance at free tickets. didn’t get lucky? you can still try for standby tickets starting at 10am the thursday before each taping.
>>
thru sun (various dates thru 8/9):
lincoln center’s fourth annual summer for the city
: lincoln center’s annual arts festival brings two months of free and choose-what-you-pay music concerts, performances, dance parties, film screenings, and more to its upper west side campus. this weekend: baand together dance festival (thru sat), national book foundation panel: celebrating 20 years of literary debuts (fri 5pm), nelly swing (fri 6:30pm), dj bembona (fri 10pm), paris to patagonia: karen kamensek conducts bizet’s
symphony in c
(fri + sat 7:30pm), globalfest (sat 4:30-11:30pm), and more.
>>
thru sun (various times):
summerstage
: summerstage presents a series of free outdoor shows this weekend: doug e. fresh + funk flex hip-hop appreciation park jam and bbq featuring doug e. fresh, taana gardner, strafe, grandmaster melle mel + scorpio, and more at crotona park in the bronx (fri 6-9pm), ghanafest-ny presents: kidi, skrewfaze, and dj chvmeleon at crotona park in the bronx (sat 6-9pm), and taiwanese waves presents: enno cheng, abao + nanguaq girls, bulareyaung dance company, and chinatown records at rumsey playfield in central park (sun 6-10pm).
>>
sponsored
: fri + sat:
flop house comedy club
: nyc’s friendliest indie comedy club—with great comics, a cozy atmosphere, and no drink minimums—has some incredible lineups this weekend! save 33% with promo code ‘skint’ for any of these shows: at 362 grand street in williamsburg – ashley gavin, anthony moore, and sean millea (friday 8pm + 9:30pm); colleen genevieve, brittany carney, and caitlin peluffo (saturday 8pm + 9:30pm); at 83 1st ave in the east village – ashley gavin, usama siddiquee, david drake, shaunak godkhindi, and mia wilson (saturday 8:30pm + 10pm). food, snacks, and drinks will be available for purchase.
>>
fri + sat (fri 6-9pm, sat 12-4pm):
open worlds at momi
: as part of ‘open worlds’ free community programs, museum of the moving image (astoria) hosts a bollywood disco talk and party with dj rekha, filmmaker saleem nasir gondal, and critic and
film comment
editor devika girish (friday), and an afternoon with cinematographer mia cioffi henry (
sorry, baby
) and film programmer shayana filmore on the art and science of cinematography and film lighting, with a focus on the impact of black innovations in the field (saturday).
>>
fri + sat (various dates thru 8/16):
47th annual bric celebrate brooklyn! festival
: new york city’s longest-running, free, outdoor performing arts festival returns to prospect park’s lena horne bandshell for two months. this weekend: mireya ramos and the poor choices, morley, and talibah safiya (fri 6pm doors); gogol bordello, puzzled panther, and pons (sat 6pm doors).
>>
fri various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
clueless
at hunter’s point south park (lic)
>>
moana 2
at bethune park (jersey city)
>>
moana 2
at twenty-four sycamores park (lenox hill)
>>
purple rain
at transmitter park (greenpoint)
>>
wicked
at southpoint park (roosevelt island)
>>
fri 10am-9pm (monthly):
first friday at poster house
: enjoy free admission, extended hours, and special programming at poster house’s first friday. today’s programming includes a subway-inspired printmaking workshop, a screening of
dr. strangelove, or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
, a neighborhood advertising walk + critique, and more. note: some activities require separate, paid tickets to participate. poster house (flatiron).
>>
fri 4-10pm (fridays thru 8/22):
warm up 2025
: kick off your summer weekends at moma ps1’s warm up, the popular outdoor music series spotlighting underground and emerging electronic talent from around the world. dance in ps1’s open-air courtyard, featuring yto barrada’s installation
le grand soir
, and explore the museum’s exhibitions until late. tonight: eric d. clark, ok williams, dj spanish fly, and masaaki. moma ps1 (lic) $25+ general, $20+ students.
>>
fri 6pm:
first novel friday
: join the center for fiction for an evening celebrating a selection of notable debut novels. the night begins with a happy hour reception in the lounge (cash bar), followed by author readings, discussion, and signings in the auditorium. tonight’s novels feature characters searching for a sense of self and place in the world while being pulled in many directions, with authors naomi xu elegant (
gingko season
), benedict nguyễn (
hot girls with balls
), stephanie wambugu (
lonely crowds
), and moderator torrey peters (
detransition, baby
). the center for fiction (fort greene), $5+ admission.
>>
fri 6:30pm (monthly):
lower east stories
: p+t knitwear bookstore + café (les) presents a storytelling salon where each month brings a fresh theme and fresh tales. tonight’s theme: ‘third chances.’ hosted by matt storrs. $10 admission ($5 of the ticket price can be applied towards any item in the bookstore or café).
>>
fri 7pm (monthly):
immigrant jam comedy
: german-born, nyc-raised comedian and actor lucie pohl (
overwatch
) celebrates all things cross-cultural, international, and delightfully different at the immigrant jam stand-up show, featuring immigrant and first generation comedians. tonight’s lineup reps china, colombia, germany, jamaica, pakistan, and romania with performers eva evans (netflix presents), fareeha khan (comedy central), felipe torres medina (
colbert
), peng dang (tiktok), and more. a portion of the proceeds will go to new women new yorkers. caveat (les), $18.76 with promo code ‘jamily’ (reg. $24-25).
>>
fri 7pm:
bryant park picnic performances: new york guitar festival presents
: bryant park’s annual summer performance series is back with 25 evenings of free live music, theater, and dance in the heart of midtown. bring your own picnic or purchase food and drinks from on-site vendors. blankets and bistro chairs are provided for use. next up: carnegie hall’s citywide series presents pianist and composer orrin evans and the grammy award–nominated captain black big band.
>>
fri 7:30pm + 9pm (ongoing):
free fridays at magnet theater
: magnet theater (chelsea) introduces free fridays, where you can catch two of their flagship improv shows — premiere: the improvised musical and the friday night show — for exactly zero dollars. first come, first served.
>>
fri 8:30pm:
bitches brew comedy show
: this women-produced and-hosted comedy show conjures up big laughs in the back room of halyards (gowanus). tonight’s performers include sabeen sadiq, alex pavone, gracie canaan, naomi karavani, and moe yacub. free admission (a tip jar will be passed around at the end of the show).
>>
fri 9pm:
the drunk texts:
harry the first, or the knave who hath liv’d
: random access theatre celebrates harry potter’s birthday with
harry the first, or the knave who hath liv’d
, a shakespearean retelling of
harry potter and the sorcerer’s stone
that combines drinking games, improvisation, and audience participation. the rat nyc (dumbo), $10-12.
>>
fri 9:30pm:
awkward sex… and the city storytelling show
: from cocaine-infused one-night stands to ibs flare-ups during cunnilingus, comedian natalie wall and guest storytellers share the humor of awkward dating and sexual encounters. caveat (les), $12 adv, $15 door.
>>
saturday
sat thru 8/10:
catvideofest 2025
: catvideofest returns to the big screen with cool kitty clips of all kinds, from fresh submissions to sourced animations, music videos, and iconic internet gems. bonus: a portion of ticket proceeds from every show will go to local animal shelters and/or animal welfare organizations. alamo drafthouse manhattan (8/2-6), ifc center (8/2-3), museum of the moving image (8/2-10), nitehawk cinema williamsburg and prospect park (8/2-10), and syndicated (8/2-6). various prices.
>>
sat + sun 6pm:
shakespeare in the garden
: stag + lion theatre co. presents their take on shakepeare’s
as you like it
in west side community garden’s floral setting. free admission.
>>
sat + sun (7pm):
blank page theatre co’s 2025 summer new works festival
: discover new stories based on today’s social climate at blank page theatre co’s 2025 summer new works festival. now in its fourth year, the festival presents four original plays centered around year’s theme of diversity, equity, and inclusion, chosen from more than 150 submissions. the tank (midtown), $23.
>>
sat various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
i am not your negro
at james baldwin lawn in st. nicholas park (harlem)
>>
the day the earth blew up: a looney tunes movie
at carroll park (carroll gardens)
>>
sat 7am-3pm (saturdays thru 8/23):
nyc summer streets festival
:the annual summer streets festival turns nyc into a car-free playground, with over 400 blocks open for walking, running, biking, and exploring across five saturdays. enjoy free performances, fitness classes, kids’ activities, and more. today: manhattan (from the brooklyn bridge to broadway and dykman street).
>>
sat 1pm:
wnyc’s public song project concert
: history remixed. wnyc’s public song project invited musicians and hobbyists alike to submit song covers and musical adaptations of books, poetry, films, and more, showcasing the creative potential of the public domain. join host simon close for an outdoor concert on the brooklyn public library’s central library plaza (prospect heights) featuring winning submissions, plus performances by winners of the anthem to us project, which asked new yorkers to reimagine a new national anthem. free admission.
>>
sat 1:30pm:
how embarrassing is jesus?
a queer psychedelic comedy
: award-winning and -losing writer lauren duca (of
teen vogue
, tucker carlson, buzzfeed, and
how to start a revolution
fame) tries to figure out if jesus can be saved in this comedy directed by obie-award-winning trans performance artist becca blackwell. caveat (les), $15 adv, $20 door.
>>
sat 5pm doors (thru 8/17):
rise up nyc
: the rise up nyc summer concert series returns with 10 free outdoor concerts across the five boroughs. tonight’s manhattan edition features johnny gill and big daddy kane outside of the apollo theatre in harlem.
>>
sat 5-9:30pm (monthly):
first saturdays at brooklyn museum: ‘en fuego’
: brooklyn museum hosts a full evening of live music, talks, film screenings, hands-on art, tours, and more. tonight’s ‘en fuego’ edition celebrates artists from the caribbean diaspora in the lead-up to the west indian day parade. free admission includes museum general admission (rsvp required).
>>
sat 6-10pm (rain date 9/20):
silent disco
: tune in to your vibe at the monthly silent disco event at riverside park’s pier i, with three djs spinning tunes of different genres straight into your wireless headphones (provided). free admission (a credit or debit card is needed for the check-in process to use the required headphones).
>>
sat 7pm (monthly):
tom d’s big new york show
: comedian and licensed nyc tour guide tom delgado takes you through different aspects of nyc each month, with history, comedy, trivia with prizes, and special guests. tonight’s show features shane torres (
conan
), tom mccaffrey (comedy central), and sheila foster (professor at columbia law school and author of
co-cities
). save $5 with promo code ‘tomdnyc’
>>
sat 7pm (monthly):
flopsauce comedy show
: the monthly stand-up showcase where comedians dish out their latest failures (flops) and successes (sauces) returns for more servings. featuring fareeha khan, christine fiala, delia kemph, guy awn, angela sawyer, and lukas arnold. hosted by kayla kirk and emily baker. secret pour (bushwick / bed-stuy), free admission.
>>
sat 7pm:
a.i. vs human comedy roast battle
: a human rapper takes on machine-learning a.i. in a comedy/rap roast battle of the times. hosted by harmon leon. the players theatre (greenwich village), a limited number of $10 tickets are available with promo code ‘theskint’ (reg. $42).
>>
sat 7:30pm (monthly):
feel the news with marcela onyango
: in this monthly variety comedy show, ‘radical lefty’ comedian marcela onyango breaks down the latest headlines—helping you decide whether to be mad, glad, or just deeply confused. each show supports direct action efforts, raising funds for mutual aid projects. tonight’s guests include katrina davis, tawanda gona, amanda gordon, mo reyes, nat towsen, and sophia v. friends and lovers (crown heights), $10.
>>
sunday
sun 2-6pm (sundays thru 8/24):
union pool’s 13th annual summer thunder concert series
: williamsburg’s union pool hosts free afternoon concerts every sunday thru summer. today: ted leo and aitis band. note: according to union pool’s instagram, admission is first come first served and rsvp is not required for entry.
>>
sun 5pm (weather permitting):
free outdoor movie
: carnegie hall presents: bizet’s
carmen
at bryant park (midtown).
>>
sun 5pm:
rejected shorts
: writer and comedian michelle cohn (vulture, mcsweeney’s) hosts a show where nyc writers and comedians join together to celebrate scorned satire, bad headlines, jokes that don’t land, and other art smacked with the cruel hand of rejection. featuring river clegg (
the new yorker
), liz hynes (
john oliver
), taylor kay phillips (mcsweeney’s), marcela onyango (feel the news), pat cassels (
samantha bee
), leah abrams (limousine reading series), and michelle chan bennett (bada swing!). caveat (les), $15.67 with promo code ‘skint’ (reg. $24-25)
>>
sun 7pm:
know it alls
: is ghosting socially acceptable? does nature or nurture win in the end? watch comedians with strong convictions battle it out over debate topics like these and more at the know it alls show. hosted by catherine lindsay. eris mainstage (williamsburg), $12 adv, $17 day of.
>>
monday
mon thru 8/24:
the tank’s limefest
: the tank’s annual limefest returns with 22 new, ‘zesty’ productions by emerging theater artists and creative teams who identify as women, non-binary, or gender nonconforming. the tank (midtown), $23+.
>>
mon various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
blades of glory
at bryant park (midtown)
>>
damn yankees
at the hudson (inwood)
>>
grease
at astoria park (queens)
>>
mon 4:30pm, 7pm (monthly):
angelika ‘classics’ screening series
: village east by angelika’s ‘classics’ screening series celebrates iconic films. next up: richard linklater’s
dazed and confused
(1993), starring wiley wiggins, jason london, matthew mcconaughey, parker posey, and ben affleck. $19.
>>
mon 6:30pm (mondays thru 8/11):
broadway by the boardwalk
: enjoy show tunes with a view at broadway by the boardwalk, an annual summer concert series featuring broadway stars performing at clinton cove in hudson river park. this outdoor event invites guests to bring blankets, stretch out on the grass, and take in an evening of music right by the water. the season continues tonight with zachary noah piser (
redwood
). free admission.
>>
mon 7pm:
david levithan + jens lekman:
songs for other people’s weddings
: writer david levithan (
every day, nick + norah’s infinite playlist
) and singer-songwriter jens lekman celebrate the launch of their new book
songs for other people’s weddings
at strand bookstore (union square) with a discussion and performance. $10 admission, $28 ticket option includes a copy of the book.
>>
mon 7:30pm (monthly):
miss manhattan non-fiction reading series
: elyssa goodman and r.c. gstaad iii’s monthly showcase for nonfiction writers returns for an evening of readings by samantha mann (
dyke delusions
), arianna rebolini (
better: a memoir about wanting to die
), ben seagreen (
rupaul’s drag race
), and holly mitchell (
mare’s nest
). niagara bar (east village), free admission.
>>
mon 8pm:
the moth storyslam
: the popular community-based open mic storytelling competition, where anyone can share a five-minute tale based on the evening’s theme to an attentive audience, returns to the bell house (gowanus). tonight’s theme: ‘childish.’ $19.65.
>>
mon 9pm:
jena friedman: motherf*cker
: comedian and writer jena friedman (
indefensible, the daily show
) works out her new hour about motherhood, grief and this current political moment before she premiers it at the edinburgh fringe. q.e.d. (astoria), $15.
>>
mon 9:30pm:
the ultimate set-up: an improvised dating game
: watch sparks fly or hilariously fizzle at
the ultimate set-up
, an improvised dating game where bold singles and the friends who volunteered them take the stage. hosted by matchmakers dr. romeo smoocherson and dr. darcy tenderfield, this show pairs participants on stage, with the audience and the singles deciding who’s a match. after the show, matched couples get free drinks, while everyone else is invited to mix and mingle the old-fashioned way. caveat (les), $15 adv, $20 door.
>>
ongoing
our roundup of 70+ ongoing events and attractions
: restaurant week, friday night fireworks in coney island, free outdoor fitness classes, and more.
>>
stay safe and healthy
– the skint

Title: TUES-THURS, 7/29-8/1: HALF-OFF CHEESECAKE, KATE BUSH PARTY, WAGNER PARK REOPENING, AND MORE

Content:
TUES-THURS, 7/29-8/1: HALF-OFF CHEESECAKE, KATE BUSH PARTY, WAGNER PARK REOPENING, AND MORE
tuesday
thru 10/29:
wagner park reopening
: after a two-year closure for resiliency improvements, downtown’s wagner park
reopens
to the public. the 3.5-acre waterfront space will host a lineup of free events through october, kicking off with an outdoor performance by taylor mac 7/29 at 7pm.
>>
thru thurs (various dates thru 8/9):
lincoln center’s fourth annual summer for the city
: lincoln center’s annual arts festival brings two months of free and choose-what-you-pay music concerts, performances, dance parties, film screenings, and more to its upper west side campus. this week: baand together dance festival (thru sat), salsa en tacones (weds 6pm), toño rosario (weds 8pm),
warriors
listening party with lin-manuel miranda and eisa davis (weds 9:30pm), funk + soul dance party with urban bush women (thurs 6:30pm), ammoye (thurs 7:30pm), and more.
>>
tues various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
elf
and
party girl
at domino park (williamsburg)
>>
the devil wears prada
at pier 17 heineken riverdeck
>>
tues 7pm:
letters + sodas: lic reading series
: writer lana schwartz (
build your own romantic comedy
) brings together comedians and writers for a night of standup, humor pieces, fiction, and essay readings at the greats of craft (lic). featuring meg reid (the onion), just lunning (the hard times), james folta (
esquire
), pooja reddy (kutti gang), brian gresko (
the atlantic
), and shem pennant (say less comedy). $5.
>>
tues 7pm:
nyc magic ensemble
: expect the unexpected as the nyc magic ensemble presents a night of magicians and mentalists at young ethel’s (south slope), featuring performers carl mercurio, sara crasson, and mike kurylo. $10 (a limited number of 2-for-$15 tickets are also available).
>>
tues 7pm (tuesdays thru 8/17):
live at the gantries
: kupferberg center for the arts presents live at the gantries, an annual outdoor concert series at gantry plaza state park (lic) showcasing local artists. tonight: afro-colombian ensemble rebolú. free admission.
>>
tues 8pm:
rooftop films: new york non-fiction 2025
: the popular rooftop films series, one of the word’s longest-running and largest outdoor showcases for indie film, returns for its 29th season. tonight: jessica earnshaw’s
baby doe
at the old american can factory (gowanus), followed by filmmaker discussion and a reception. $20.
>>
tues 8pm:
live band karaoke at arlene’s grocery
: choose from a wide assortment of rock and pop songs and take the stage with your very own live band (nakatomi5) backing you up at arlene’s grocery (les). $10 adv, $15 door.
>>
sponsored
The number-one song of the land in the summer of 1995 was a meaningful gem from a trio called TLC.
Party Like It’s 1999: Don’t Go Chasing Waterfalls Edition
will mark that 30th anniversary by giving you double shots of T-Boz, Chilli and Left Eye all night long. Plus DJ Steve will also serve up our usual mix of the best rock, pop, R&B, hip-hop and dance tunes from the 1990s and 2000s!
Unhitch that overall strap, lace up your Docs, tie that flannel around your waist, put on some frosted lip gloss and set your VCR to record Dawson’s Creek and Gilmore Girls — Party Like it’s 1999 is Brooklyn’s best 1990s and 2000s dance party where you’ll shake it to the best pop, rock, hip hop and R&B jams all night long!
Party Like It’s 1999: Don’t Go Chasing Waterfalls Edition
Saturday, August 9 10:30pm – 3:30 am
Doors: 10:00pm | Show: 10:30pm
Littlefield
635 Sackett Street
Brooklyn, NY 11217
• R to Union Street, then
one block to Sackett Street
• 2, 3, 4, 5, B, D, N, Q to
Atlantic Avenue or Pacific Street. 9 blocks south to Sackett Street
GET TICKETS
wednesday
weds thru 8/5:
silent movie week at moma
: the museum of modern art presents its third annual silent movie week, featuring seven recently restored silent films from 1923-28. the series opens with walter ruttmann’s
berlin: symphony of a city
, presented with live musical accompaniment in the abby aldrich rockefeller sculpture garden (weather permitting). museum of modern art (midtown), $14 general, $12 seniors, $10 students.
>>
weds various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
captain america: brave new world
at rainey park (lic)
>>
dark toons
at brooklyn commons park (downtown brooklyn)
>>
dirty dancing
at resiliencity park (hoboken)
>>
kung fu panda 4
at tompkins square park (east village)
>>
mean girls
at prospect park (prospect park)
>>
the grand budapest hotel
at pier i in riverside park south (uws)
>>
sponsored
:
up
at parklife (gowanus). note: food/drink purchase required.
>>
weds 12-6pm:
50% off eileen’s special cheesecake
: say cheese(cake)! eileen’s special cheesecake shop in nolita is celebrating its 50th anniversary (and national cheesecake day) with 50% off all individual and 6-inch cheesecakes. while supplies last.
>>
weds 6pm (wednesdays thru 8/13):
summer concerts at hudson yards
: the annual concert series returns to the public square + gardens at hudson yards for eight weeks. tonight: country singer–songwriter brittney spencer with an opening set by dj chachi. free admission.
>>
weds 7pm (monthly):
not in my backyard! a political comedy roundtable
: a panel of opinionated nyc comedians, journalists, and politicians debate the local issues causing drama in your neighborhood’s facebook group. each show will also include a pop quiz on nyc knowledge. hosted by cody lindquist (
our cartoon president
) and charlie todd (improv everywhere), with panelists anthony atamanuik (
what we do in the shadows
), lindsey boylan (campaign to stop cuomo), and catherine vaughan (abundance new york). ucb (east village), $10 adv, $15 day of.
>>
weds 7pm:
artists + beers
: pair cinema with cervezas at ‘artists + beers,’ a semi-monthly screening series highlighting short films, docs, and music videos by local filmmakers. hosted by nancy pop, curran banach, and chip parham. all night skate (bed-stuy), free admission.
>>
weds 7pm (wednesdays thru 8/13):
jazz at pier 84
: jazz up your evening with the jazz foundation of america’s free outdoor concerts at hudson river park’s pier 84 (hell’s kitchen). the season continues with pucci amanda jhones.
>>
weds 8pm:
ambush comedy show
: the ambush comedy show buzzes into hellrazor barber shop in williamsburg with a lineup featuring sarah tollemache (comedy central), ashton womack (
the daily show
), ashlynn salzano (
that time of the week
), alex dragicevich, and tim smith. hosted by josh johnson, brittany cardwell, and lucas connolly. free admission.
>>
weds 9:30pm (weekly):
friends with caveats
: expect everything from stand-up and character performances to music and even powerpoint presentations at caveat’s weekly comedy show, ‘friends with caveats.’ tonight’s lineup features myq kaplan (comedy central), adam mitrani (
why aren’t you more famous?
), rebecca weiser (reductress), nikolai vanyo (vocabaret), ben miller, jimmy ong, and chesarae. hosted by delia kemph. caveat (les), $10 adv, $15 door.
>>
thursday
thurs thru 8/17:
the little shakespeare festival: ‘not your english teacher’s shakespeare’
: frigid new york’s annual little shakespeare festival invites indie theatre companies to put their own spin on the bard’s classics. this year’s 10 productions include a shakespearean parody of
the princess bride
, a telenova-style
hamlet
, and more. under st. marks (east village), $20-25.
>>
thurs thru 8/10:
48th asian american international film festival
: the annual asian american international film festival, presented by asian cinevision, presents 11 days of indie films and programming at asia society, welcome to chinatown hub, regal union square, and online. various prices.
>>
thurs various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
a minecraft movie
at tanahey playground (les)
>>
ferris bueller’s day off
at coney island beach at w 12th street
>>
men in black
at union square park
>>
monsters university
at boyd mcguiness park (jersey city)
>>
the matrix
at brooklyn bridge park – pier 1 harbor viewn lawn
>>
thurs (various times):
summerstage
: summerstage presents a pair of free outdoor shows tonight: frankie negrón, christian alicea, and funk salsa urban at crotona park in the bronx (5-9pm) and summer dayes 2025 with the yussef dayes experience, fkj, venna, and salin at rumsey playfield in central park (6-10pm).
>>
thurs 12:30pm (season ends today):
broadway in bryant park
: broadway comes to bryant park as stars perform some of their biggest hits at this annual lunchtime performance series. today: ‘disney on broadway’ with
aladdin
,
beauty and the beast
, and
the lion king
). hosted by lite fm’s cubby and christine. free admission.
>>
thurs 6pm (season ends tonight):
live at the archway: summer music + art in the dumbo archway
: sights and sounds fill the public plaza underneath the manhattan bridge in dumbo. tonight: psychedelic cumbia group chicha libre and chelsea bonosky. food and drink will be available for purchase. rain or shine. free admission.
>>
thurs 6:30pm:
winging it: an open mic night at lofty pigeon books
: share your script, your poem, your music, your jokes, or just your support at this open mic night held at kensington’s lofty pigeon books, hosted by comedian, performer, author, and
new yorker
cartoonist emily flake. light refreshments will be served, and attendees will save 10% on store purchases. free admission.
>>
thurs 6:30pm (season ends tonight):
summer music series at bushwick inlet park
: soak up the sounds and skyline river sunset at the friends of bushwick inlet park’s fifth annual summer music series. tonight: carol sudhalter quintet. 86 kent shoreline esplanade (williamsburg), free admission.
>>
thurs 6:30pm (thursdays thru 8/14):
sunset salsa
: dance into golden hour at hudson river park’s sunset salsa series, returning to pier 76 (midtown west) for the summer. led by performer and instructor talía castro-pozo, each night kicks off with a beginner salsa lesson—open to first-timers and seasoned dancers alike—followed by an open dance party with guest djs. free admission.
>>
thurs 7pm (monthly):
golden spiral comedy show
: at mindy raf and katie compa’s golden spiral comedy show, stand-up set lengths follow the fibonacci sequence (5, 8, 13, and 21 minutes each). tonight’s show at whiskey cellar nyc (east village) includes guests kendra dawsey, sue funke, jilberto soto, and leighann lord. advance ticket purchase includes a raffle ticket for a free drink. a limited number of tickets are available for $7.18 with promo code ‘skintspiral’ (reg. $10.38+).
>>
thurs 7pm doors (season ends tonight):
river + blues concert series
: settle in for sunset sounds at nelson a. rockefeller park, where the annual river + blues concert series brings global and american folk, roots, and blues artists to the waterfront. bring a blanket or lawn chair, pack a picnic (or purchase snacks and drinks on-site), and enjoy the music with hudson river views. tonight: lady blackbird with opener dj blessed. free admission.
>>
thurs 7:30pm (season ends tonight):
astoria park concert series
: central astoria ldc’s annual concert series returns with four nights of live music on the ditmars side lawn at astoria park. tonight: the sky high band (90s/2000s hits). free admission.
>>
thurs 9:30pm:
fightin’ words! a language game show
: three contestants compete in a series of word-based games to win the ultimate prize: a new word of their creation will be added to the people’s lexicon. featuring guest contestants michael cruz cayne, whitley watson, and rachel coster. hosted by jerzy gwiazdowski. $13.61 with promo code ‘skintwords’ (reg. $18.76-20).
>>
thurs 10pm:
happy birthday, kate: a kate bush party
: bush bash! dj bright light bright light’s annual dance party celebrating all things kate bush returns to c’mon everybody (bed-stuy). $12.36.
>>
ongoing
our roundup of 70+ ongoing events and attractions
: restaurant week, friday night fireworks in coney island, shakespeare in the parking lot, chain theatre’s summer one-act festival, free outdoor fitness classes, and more.
>>
stay safe and healthy
– the skint

Title: FRI-MON, 7/25-28: SKINT WEEKEND

Content:
FRI-MON, 7/25-28: SKINT WEEKEND
cultural fests / street fairs / food events / markets / shopping events
(free admission, unless noted otherwise):
► thru sun:
46th annual thunderbird american indian powwow
: queens county farm museum. $19 admission supports thunderbird american indian dancers scholarship fund and the queens county farm museum education program.
>>
► thru sun:
115th annual st. ann’s feast (fka st. ann italian festival)
: 7th + jefferson streets (hoboken).
>>
► fri 8-11:30pm (+ 8/15):
chinatown night market’s final season
: forsyth plaza.
>>
► sat 11am-5pm:
wax + stacks: brooklyn flea record fair
: new york public library for the performing arts (uws).
>>
►
sponsored

returns to the Brooklyn Navy Yard Waterfront Promenade on

Title: TUES-THURS, 7/22-24: UPTOWN BOUNCE, THE AUD BALL, DISNEY PAGEANT, AND MORE

Content:
TUES-THURS, 7/22-24: UPTOWN BOUNCE, THE AUD BALL, DISNEY PAGEANT, AND MORE
tuesday
movies at the united palace with lin-manuel miranda and leslie odom, jr.: reservations are now available
: the movies at the united palace (washington heights) series celebrates the 10-year anniversary of
hamilton
on broadway with a series of films and tv series starring the original cast. next up:
blindspotting
(2021), followed by a discussion with lin-manuel miranda, daveed diggs, and jasmine cephas jones. free tickets to the 7/28 event are now available.
>>
thru thurs (various dates thru 8/9):
lincoln center’s fourth annual summer for the city
: lincoln center’s annual arts festival brings two months of free and choose-what-you-pay music concerts, performances, dance parties, film screenings, and more to its upper west side campus. this week: ‘folklore and legends’ : jonathon heyward conducts brahms’s first symphony (tues + weds 7:30pm), sekou mcmiller and the palladium mambo band (weds 6pm),
waitress: the musical
in american sign language by deaf broadway (weds 8pm), library silent disco: decades party 1965-2025 with dj bill coleman (weds 8pm), social dance (tango): leonardo suarez-paz: ‘piazzolla100’ (thurs 6:30pm), and more.
>>
tues various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
the great gatsby
at pier 17 heineken riverdeck (lower manhattan)
>>
transformers one
at arlington park (jersey city)
>>
tues 5pm (+ 8/16):
hamilton
celebrates 10 years at hudson yards
: broadway’s
hamilton
celebrates 10 years with a series of free events at hudson yards’ public square + gardens. tonight: past and present cast members—including miguel cervantes, hannah cruz, thayne jasperson, and edred utomi—come together for a behind-the-scenes conversation about their journey with the show, from its early days to its future legacy.
>>
tues 7pm (monthly):
we love a theme: a storytelling show
: a lineup of performers tell funny, heartwarming, and cringe-inducing tales at bailey swilley’s monthly storytelling show. tonight’s ‘burned’ theme features calvin cato, adam selbst, wes hazard, and carly ciarrochi. pete’s candy store (williamsburg), free ($5 suggested donation).
>>
tues 7pm:
jazz foundation presents: sunset sounds
: the jazz foundation of america presents a pair of sunset concerts on the hudson. tonight’s finale: axel tosca trio with xiomara laugart. pier i at 70th street, free admission.
>>
tues 7pm (tuesdays thru 8/17):
live at the gantries
: kupferberg center for the arts presents live at the gantries, an annual outdoor concert series at gantry plaza state park (lic) showcasing local artists. tonight: gotham kings, led by two-time grammy-nominated trumpeter alphonso horne. free admission.
>>
tues 8pm (+ 8/5):
naumburg orchestral concerts: 2025 season
: the naumburg orchestral concerts series returns for its 120th season at historic naumburg bandshell in central park. tonight: nosky’s baroque band, conducted by aisslinn nosky, performs works by handel, haydn, and vivaldi. hosted by wqxr’s annie bergen. all concerts will be broadcast live. free admission.
>>
tues 8pm:
cinema smootaphilia
: ‘summer heat’: ensemble erotic (ann courtney on vocals, dave smoota smith on casio and beats, jerome jordan on guitar, and jeremy kay on bass) perform a live, original soundtrack to a compilation of some of the hottest, most original, and captivating sex scenes in cinema history. tv eye (ridgewood), $17.
>>
sponsored
The
Brooklyn Summer Beer Wine And Spirits Fest
returns to the Brooklyn Navy Yard Waterfront Promenade on
Saturday, July 26
with more than 100 styles of beer, wine, and sprits from producers near and far!  It’s the perfect chance to hang with friends and chat with brewers, sommeliers, and master distillers about the craft behind your next favorite go-to pours.
Guests can enjoy unlimited samples for the entire session, along with live entertainment, interactive games, and access to food available for purchase from Chavas Empanadas, Mozzarepas, and Taste of Poland.

Session Times:
Session 1: 1pm – 4:30pm
Session 2: 6pm – 9:30pm
Brooklyn Navy Yard Building 77 Waterfront Promenade
141 Flushing Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11205
21+ Only
wednesday
weds various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
a minecraft movie
at walter francis white playground (east harlem)
>>
clueless
at resiliencity park (hoboken)
>>
dirty dancing
at pier i in riverside park south (uws)
>>
guardians of the galaxy vol. 3
at sunset park (brooklyn)
>>
hairspray
at elizabeth street garden (nolita)
>>
sponsored
:
rhinestone
at parklife (gowanus). note: food/drink purchase required.
>>
trapped: mind-altering shorts 2025
at brooklyn commons park (downtown brooklyn)
>>
weds 6pm:
carnegie hall citywide: catalyst quartet
: carnegie hall presents a series of free concerts across nyc. tonight: grammy award–winning catalyst quartet comes to madison square park’s oval lawn for an outdoor concert featuring works by pete seeger, joni mitchell, joseph kosma, will holt, aftab darvishi, and astor piazzolla. free admission.
>>
weds 6pm (wednesdays thru 8/13):
summer concerts at hudson yards
: the annual concert series returns to the public square + gardens at hudson yards for eight weeks. tonight: singer-songwriter alex sampson with an opening set by dj chachi. free admission.
>>
weds 7pm:
peer revue
: ted talks with a twist. peer revue makes its debut with real experts giving real talks on big ideas—like quarks or the fall of rome—while comedians wing it through slides they’ve never seen before. hosted by ben lillie, with emily costa (
facts machine
), paula croxson (
the story collider
), andrea-jones rooy (
the data science spectacular
), brian morabito (
dropout
), brielle demirjian (
the daily show
), mick szal (
and scene
), and more. caveat (les), $13.61 with promo code ‘skintrevue’ (reg. $18.76-20)
>>
weds 7pm (series ends tonight):
summer sounds! at carl schurz park
: steel impressions caribbean band returns for this year’s summer sounds! concert series, presented by the carl schurz park conservancy at the elevated john finley walk (yorkville). free admission.
>>
weds 7:30pm:
taste of science: ticks
: the fordam tick index is currently at 8/10. but how much do you really know about these tiny monsters? taste of science presents a talk at ryan’s daughter pub (ues) with two experts on ticks and the diseases they carry, including tips for protecting yourself in the outdoors this summer. free admission (donations welcome).
>>
weds 7:30pm:
well well well! comedy
: chuckles for charity. co-hosts griffin leeds and nora jefferies present an all-lgbtq+ comedy show at the rosemont (williamsburg), with proceeds benefiting the ali forney center. featuring jared goldstein, jilberto soto, aurea young, and julia wendt. $9 suggested donation.
>>
weds 7:30pm:
we have fun: a stand-up show
: hosts zach sims and dan wilbur team up to bring the fun-ny to young ethel’s (south slope), with stand-up by nat towsen (
fallon
), katie blunt (milk and cookies comedy), jim search (
upstate understandings
, and joe briggs (
the boys are back
). free admission.
>>
weds 8pm (monthly):
ditmas lit
: a diverse range of fiction writers, storytellers, poets, and essayists share their work at the ditmas lit series, returning to the urbane arts club (ditmas park) with belle ling (
a seed and a plant
), anthony thomas lombardi (
murmurations
), heather mccalden (
the observable universe
), and ruben reyes, jr. (
there is a rio grande in heaven
). free admission.
>>
weds 8pm:
the moth storytelling show: community showcase
: the moth community program, which brings storytelling to nonprofits and cultural organizations, presents an evening of true stories told by six storytellers at roulette intermedium (boerum hill). $17.50.
>>
weds 8pm:
ambush comedy show
: the ambush comedy show buzzes into hellrazor barber shop in williamsburg with a lineup featuring andy haynes (comedy central), jared goldstein (
after midnight
), sam evans (
cracked
), usama siddiquee (showtime), and raj suresh (siriusxm). hosted by josh johnson, lucas connolly, and brittany cardwell. free admission.
>>
weds 8pm:
the aud ball: justice for all
: drag performer suddenly audrey’s aud ball celebrates the dc universe and gotham glamour with a high-powered night of drag performances, dancing, cosplay, and a queer vendor market at 3 dollar bill (east williamsburg). $14.48 with promo code ‘punkrocker’ (reg. $19.48 adv, $34.95 day of).
>>
weds 8:30pm:
spell checc: a spelling bee gameshow
: watch comedians butcher tough words from all sorts of categories while racking up (or losing) points for making each other—and the announcer—crack up at this spelling bee packed with roasts, lifelines, and comedic chaos. the last speller standing wins bragging rights and a thrifted trophy from a random sporting event. featuring chloe troast, kyle gordon, simmi singh, and dan toomey with hosts jorge oyola and michael sanky. ucb (east village), $10 adv, $15 day of.
>>
thursday
thurs thru 8/17 (thursdays-sundays at 6:30pm):
hudson classical theater company:
the lady from the sea
: hudson classical theater company celebrates its 22nd summer season with intimate, outdoor productions henrick ibsen’s
the lady from the sea
at the soldiers’ and sailors’ monument in riverside park (uws). pay-what-you-can admission (donations will be accepted following the show).
>>
thurs various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
anchorman: the legend of ron burgundy
at coney island beach at w 12th street
>>
moana 2
at irving square park (bushwick)
>>
sonic the hedgehog 3
at the unisphere in flushing meadows corona park (queens)
>>
the goonies
at fosun plaza at 28 liberty street (lower manhattan)
>>
the muppets take manhattan
at union square park
>>
the wild robot
at bayside park (jersey city)
>>
waitress
at brooklyn bridge park – pier 1 harbor view lawn (brooklyn bridge park)
>>
wicked
at vincent f. albano jr. playground (kips bay)
>>
thurs 12:30pm (thursdays thru 7/31):
broadway in bryant park
: broadway comes to bryant park as stars perform some of their biggest hits at this annual lunchtime performance series. today:
hadestown
,
hamilton
,
mamma mia!
,
moulin rouge! the musical
,
six
, and
the outsiders
with a pre-show by the amda college of the performing arts. hosted by lite fm’s rich kaminski. free admission.
>>
thurs 6pm (thursdays thru 7/31):
live at the archway: summer music + art in the dumbo archway
: sights and sounds fill the public plaza underneath the manhattan bridge in dumbo. tonight: Philly-based singer-songwriter sug daniels and jenn macksoud. food and drink will be available for purchase. rain or shine. free admission.
>>
thurs 6-9pm:
12th annual uptown bounce
: two museums, one block party—
el museo del barrio
and the
museum of the city of new york
team up once again for the annual uptown bounce. expect djs, dancing, free museum admission, and more, with unique programming at each spot. and since they’re right across the street, feel free to bounce between both all evening long.
thurs 6:30pm (thursdays thru 7/31):
summer music series at bushwick inlet park
: soak up the sounds and skyline river sunset at the friends of bushwick inlet park’s fifth annual summer music series. tonight: george gray jazz coalition. 86 kent shoreline esplanade (williamsburg), free admission.
>>
thurs 6:30pm (thursdays thru 8/14):
sunset salsa
: dance into golden hour at hudson river park’s sunset salsa series, returning to pier 76 (midtown west) for the summer. led by performer and instructor talía castro-pozo, each night kicks off with a beginner salsa lesson—open to first-timers and seasoned dancers alike—followed by an open dance party with guest djs. free admission.
>>
thurs 7pm:
top shelf stories
: julia whitehouse serves up an evening of carefully crafted storytelling at ucb (east village). tonight’s show features guests pavar snipe, natasha vaynblat, sharon spell, and nat townsen, plus one open mic slot reserved for an audience member. hosted by julia whitehouse. $10 adv, $15 day of.
>>
thurs 7pm doors (thursdays thru 7/31):
river + blues concert series
: settle in for sunset sounds at nelson a. rockefeller park, where the annual river + blues concert series brings global and american folk, roots, and blues artists to the waterfront. bring a blanket or lawn chair, pack a picnic (or purchase snacks and drinks on-site), and enjoy the music with hudson river views. tonight: afro latin jazz orchestra and guests led by arturo o’farrill, with opener dj reagonomics. free admission.
>>
thurs 7pm doors:
f*bomb presents: hole tribute
: following up last month’s nirvana tribute concert, the f*bomb rock + roll party gets grungy again with a tribute to hole. the bowery electric (east village), $15 adv, $20 door.
>>
thurs 7pm doors, 8pm show:
divaland presents: disney channel pageant
: eight drag contestants go head-to-head in three nostalgia-fueled categories inspired by the disney channel shows you couldn’t get enough of. judged by
wizards of waverly place
alum dan benson and
rupaul’s drag race
’s robin fierce, and hosted by jessica rose and frida cox. 3 dollar bill (east williamsburg), $19.48+.
>>
thurs 7:30pm (thursdays thru 7/31):
astoria park concert series
: central astoria ldc’s annual concert series returns with four nights of live music on the ditmars side lawn at astoria park. tonight: cc + the boys (country hits). free admission.
>>
thurs 8pm doors:
landline comedy at wild east brewing co.
: landline comedy serves up pints of hoppy humor straight from the barrel cellar at wild east brewing co. (gowanus). tonight’s lineup includes caitlin peluffo (
fallon
), toby mcmullen (
dynamite rocketship
), vicki ferentinos (bravo), shane o’connor (the onion), andre medrano (don’t tell comedy), and marecella denby. hosted by andre medrano. bonus: rsvp for a chance to win a free drink. free admission.
>>
thurs 9pm:
a night like this: the cure music video party
: join dj chase coppins and the cure documentarian arusha for a night of projected music videos and other specially-curated visuals accompanying the songs of the cure and their influences, contemporaries, and successors. bar freda (ridgewood), free admission.
>>
ongoing
our roundup of 80+ ongoing events and attractions
: friday night fireworks in coney island, shakespeare in the parking lot, chain theatre’s summer one-act festival, free outdoor fitness classes, and more.
>>
stay safe and healthy
– the skint

Title: FRI-MON, 7/18-21: SKINT WEEKEND

Content:
FRI-MON, 7/18-21: SKINT WEEKEND
cultural fests / street fairs / food events / markets / shopping events
(free admission, unless noted otherwise):
► fri 6-8pm:
art gurl’s third birthday celebration pop-up
: mccarren parkhouse (williamsburg), $5 admission.
>>

: fort greene location.

free gelato

sponsored
The
Summer Beer Wine And Spirits Fest
comes to the renowned
Queens Botanical Garden
on
Saturday, July 19
, pouring more than 100 styles of beer, wine, and sprits from producers near and far!  It’s a perfect chance to view the beautiful summer canna lilies, lantanas, and orchids, hang with friends, discover new favorites, and chat with brewers, sommeliers, and master distillers about the craft behind your next favorite go-to pours.
Guests can enjoy unlimited samples all afternoon, plus live entertainment, interactive games, and access to food available for purchase from Lobster Cart, Mozzarepas, and Taste of Poland.
Special offer for the skint readers
:
Save 40% on advance tickets with promo code SKINT
GET TICKETS NOW!
Queens Botanical Garden Summer Beer Wine And Spirits Fest
Saturday, July 19
1PM-4:30pm
Queens Botanical Garden
43-50 Main Street Flushing, NY 11355
21+ Only
friday
sponsored
: thru 8/10:
★★★★★ ‘rocked the rafters with bright laughter and gasps of pleasure!’ –
ithaca times
: twilight theatre co. in association with kitchen theatre company presents brian dykstra’s
polishing shakespeare
at 59e59 theaters. a dot-com billionaire pays an esteemed american theatre company to translate shakespeare into english (wait. what?). a sly comedy inspired by an unbelievably true story. to sell out or not to sell out—is that the question? use code skint to snag $19 tickets* (reg. $44)!
>>
thru 7/31:
kurosawa in 4k
: film forum (south village) presents a nine-film festival featuring 4k restorations of some of akira kurosawa’s most influential titles, spanning genres from samurai epic to gritty noir:
high and low, ikiru, rashomon, seven samurai, sanjuro, stray dog, the hidden fortress, throne of blood
, and
yojimbo
. $17.
>>
thru 7/31:
‘nyc 2000s’
: take a look back at the big apple through the aughts at bam’s ‘nyc 2000s’ screening series:
25th hour, brother to brother, man push cart, pieces of april, the devil wears prada, the royal tenenbaums, vanilla sky
, and more. bam rose cinemas (fort greene), $17 general, $12 seniors.
>>
thru sun:
sponsored
:
get insider access to the city’s best secrets this weekend with new york adventure club!
go behind-the-scenes at saint thomas church with an exclusive bell tower climb; explore the gilded age mansions and memorials of riverside drive; go inside the little red lighthouse underneath the george washington bridge; uncover the secret history of new york penn station and moynihan train hall; explore the seaside village of city island; and much more this weekend and beyond with new york adventure club!
>>
thru sun (various dates thru 8/9):
lincoln center’s fourth annual summer for the city
: lincoln center’s annual arts festival brings two months of free and choose-what-you-pay music concerts, performances, dance parties, film screenings, and more to its upper west side campus. next up: brazil week—a week of concerts and cultural programs featuring latin grammy nominee melly, art-pop diva anelis assumpção, soul-samba singer liniker, and more.
>>
fri various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
guardians of the galaxy vol. 3
at southpoint park (roosevelt island)
>>
mufasa: the lion king
at kaiser park baseball field (coney island)
>>
top gun: maverick
at transmitter park (greenpoint)
>>
vivo
at hamilton fish park (les)
>>
fri 4-10pm (fridays thru 8/22):
warm up 2025
: kick off your summer weekends at moma ps1’s warm up, the popular outdoor music series spotlighting underground and emerging electronic talent from around the world. dance in ps1’s open-air courtyard, featuring yto barrada’s installation
le grand soir
, and explore the museum’s exhibitions until late. tonight: mikeq, dj empress, alex zhang hungtai, tashi dorji, and lydo. moma ps1 (lic) $25+ general, $20+ students.
>>
fri 7pm (monthly):
kweendom
: come out for the kweendom lgbtq+ comedy and storytelling show, featuring performances by carolyn bergier, micah eames, riylan mills, eddie estrada, and marcos montana. pete’s candy store (williamsburg), free admission (donations are welcome and will benefit the here to pee tour).
>>
fri 7pm:
bryant park picnic performances: new york guitar festival presents
: bryant park’s annual summer performance series is back with 25 evenings of free live music, theater, and dance in the heart of midtown. bring your own picnic or purchase food and drinks from on-site vendors. blankets and bistro chairs are provided for use. next up: carnegie hall’s citywide series presents award-winning salsa dura band la excelencia.
>>
fri 8pm:
laugh it off
: bring your problems to the laugh it off show, where audience members submit their everyday problems and comedians try their best to ‘fix’ them. boyb. melrose podcasts (east village), $16.
>>
fri 8:30pm:
bitches brew comedy show
: this women-produced and-hosted comedy show conjures up big laughs in the back room of halyards (gowanus). tonight’s performers include jonathan van halem (
fallon
), rojo perez (comedy central), mustafa mussa (don’t tell comedy), allie lawrence (off menu comedy), and gabbie watts (siriusxm). free admission (a tip jar will be passed around at the end of the show).
>>
fri 9pm:
niche night party: come out and play! 90s + early 2000s alt night
: dance the night away to grunge, pop-punk, 90’s, and early 2000’s alternative, with a little bit of pop sprinkled in. revision lounge (alphabet city), free admission.
>>
saturday
sat thru 8/24 (weekends 1-6pm):
brooklyn waterfront artists coalition’s summer exhibitions
: bwac’s seasonal art show fills its 25,000 square foot gallery on the brooklyn waterfront with three new exhibitions: ‘elements of movement’ member show, ‘brooklyn x pittsburgh: the industry of art’ juried exhibition, and ‘amped: the art of rock + roll.’ opening reception 7/19 1-6 pm. bwac gallery (red hook), free admission (donations welcome).
>>
sat thru 8/17:
rise up nyc
: the rise up nyc summer concert series returns with 10 free outdoor concerts across the five boroughs. this weekend’s brooklyn edition includes beenie man and patrice roberts (sat), fabolous, lloyd, honey bxby, jon b, and jennaske (sun), and hezekiah walker, donnie mcclurkin, john p. kee, and erica campbell (mon) at wingate park in prospect-lefferts gardens.
>>
sat + sun (sat 6-10pm, sun 7-10pm):
dj rekha + the roots at flushing meadows corona park
: summerstage presents a pair of free outdoor shows at flushing meadows corona park (queens): dj rekha’s basement bhangra beyond (sat) and the roots with dj scratch (sun).
>>
sat various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
toy story
at bella abzug park (hell’s kitchen)
>>
wicked
at shore park and parkway (bay ridge)
>>
sat 2:45-7pm:
free show brain concert
: show brain returns to maria hernandez park (bushwick) for a free outdoor concert featuring a place to bury strangers, pop music fever dream, venus twins, pons, and dog date.
>>
sat 3pm doors (various dates thru 8/16):
47th annual bric celebrate brooklyn! festival
: new york city’s longest-running free outdoor performing arts festival heads to brower park in crown heights for an evening of film, hip-hop, and reggae, with live performances by johnny osbourne, smif-n-wessun, chip-fu, and bush babees, plus dj sets by ayanna heaven, gabsoul, and dj gringo. the night wraps up with a screening of
bam bam: the sister nancy story
introduced by director alison duke.
>>
sat 6:30pm:
scream scene presents:
child’s play
: find your friend to the end at scream scene’s screening of
child’s play
(1988) at pine box rock shop (bushwick). free admission.
>>
sat 7:30pm:
ready reroll: dungeons and dragons live theater show – ‘break into cyborg prison’ edition
: test your dice-rolling skills at a live-action dungeons and dragons theater show, where audience members can help determine the fate of the actors and comedians improvising their way through the saga. chain theatre (midtown west), $10 adv, $12 door.
>>
sat 9pm:
the legend of you! the personalized improvised adventure
: musical improv meets fantasy adventure meets your latest therapy session in ‘the legend of you: the personalized improvised adventure.’ each performance kicks off with an everyday problem shared by an audience member, which the cast transforms into an epic quest packed with bespoke monsters, magical treasures, and plenty of singing. the rat nyc (dumbo), $15 with promo code ‘washedup’ (reg. $30).
>>
sunday
sun 2pm (+ 8/7, 8/14, 8/28):
the queens jazz trail concert series
: inspired by the queens jazz trail map highlighting the homes of jazz legends, the annual the queens jazz trail concert series presents seven free jazz concerts in queens parks. tonight: alí bello + the charanga syndicate at the unisphere in flushing meadows corona park (queens).
>>
sun 2-6pm (sundays thru 8/24):
union pool’s 13th annual summer thunder concert series
: williamsburg’s union pool hosts free afternoon concerts every sunday thru summer. today: hannah cohen, evan wright, and dj sara abruna. note: according to union pool’s instagram, admission is first come first served and rsvp is not required for entry.
>>
sun 3pm:
resounding silents: live-scored surrealist silent shorts
: the resounding silents film series presents a screening of surrealist short films from the 1920s-40s, accompanied by an original, live score performed by singer-songwriter ally brown, michael lucarelli, and anthime miller. the living gallery (bushwick), $15 suggested.
>>
sun 5pm (+ 8/17, 8/31, 9/14, 9/28):
poetry at elizabeth street garden
: poets muse on a chosen theme at this outdoor reading series at elizabeth street garden (nolita), where anyone can submit work in advance for a chance to read. today’s theme: ‘current.’ presented by mcnally jackson bookstore with hosts yvonne brooks and joseph reiver. free admission.
>>
sun 7pm (monthly):
new tricks
: good tales don’t age at this storytelling show where all of the performers are over 40. hosted by adrianne frost (the moth storyslam champion) with stories by tracey starin, marc abbot, kambri crews, rita rigano, and ronna levy. tonight’s theme: ‘boom!’ q.e.d. (astoria), $12.
>>
sun 7pm (sundays thru 7/27):
summer on the hudson: amplified sundays
: wind down the weekend with amplified sundays, a golden hour outdoor live music series at pier i in riverside park south (uws). tonight: slavic soul party. free admission.
>>
sun 7:30pm:
character night
: discover new, unusual, and funny characters, impressions, and bits created by a lineup of imaginative performers. hosted by jon monje, paul ton, and sonia nam. magnet theater (chelsea), $10.
>>
sun 7:30pm (monthly):
good god comedy show
: audience members can anonymously share their craziest, cringiest secrets for the hosts to read aloud at this stand-up comedy variety show. tonight’s lineup: joyelle johnson, olivia stadler, jared goldstein, josh nasser, and sara hennessey. hosted by caitlin cook and brittany carney. union hall (park slope), $10 adv, $15 door.
>>
sun 8pm (monthly)
disasterpiece movie night:
andy the talking hedgehog
: from the weird to the wondrous, disasterpiece unearths bad movies for a watch party complete with drinking games, trivia, pizza, and more. tonight: fantasy adventure
andy the talking hedgehog
(2018). wonderville (bushwick), free admission.
>>
sun 9pm (monthly):
you are not alone: an uplifting show about depression
: improvisers and artists that battle depression and mental illness in their day-to-day lives create scenes inspired by personal experiences, showing how laughter can be the best medicine. hosted by aaron gold and michael serpe. magnet theater (chelsea), $10.
>>
monday
mon thru 8/17:
summer restaurant week
: 600 restaurants across nyc serve up special two-course prix-fixe lunches and three-course dinners for $30, $45, or $60.
>>
mon thru 7/27:
trashfest
, and
darkfest
at the tank
: the tank (garment district) presents a pair of eco-forward theatrical series:
trashfest
, which minimizes waste and uses repurposed materials, and
darkfest
, which experiments with alternative lighting sources like candles and flashlights. various prices.
>>
mon various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
ghost
at bryant park (midtown)
>>
ghost world
at pacific park (prospect heights)
>>
la vita è bella (life is beautfiul)
at the hudson (inwood)
>>
mon 4pm, 7pm:
classics in black + white:
dark passage
:
village east
and
cinema 123
by angelika host a series of classic black + white screenings, continuing tonight with delmer daves’
dark passage
(1947), starring humphrey bogart, lauren bacall, and agnes moorehead. $19.
mon 6:30pm (mondays thru 8/11):
broadway by the boardwalk
: enjoy show tunes with a view at broadway by the boardwalk, an annual summer concert series featuring broadway stars performing at clinton cove in hudson river park. this outdoor event invites guests to bring blankets, stretch out on the grass, and take in an evening of music right by the water. the season continues tonight with tony and grammy winner john lloyd young (
jersey boys
). free admission.
>>
mon 7pm (monthly):
and scene
: anything could happen when actors and improvisors share the stage at ‘and scene,’ where the actors know their lines ahead of time and the improvisers make up their parts with no prior knowledge of the scenes. featuring mick szal, quincy dunn-baker, ben frankhauser, connor ratliff, ify nwadiwe, alex dickson, and more. $18.76 with promo code ‘brick’ (reg. $24-25).
>>
mon 7:30pm:
dirty little secrets improv show
: see your secrets turned into comedy gold at the dirty little secrets show, where your anonymously-submitted confessions serve as inspiration for improv performers. the wara theatre (east village), $14.64 with promo code ‘skintsecrets’ (reg. $23.18).
>>
ongoing
our roundup of 80+ ongoing events and attractions
: friday night fireworks in coney island, shakespeare in the parking lot, our lady of mount carmel feast in williamsburg, and more.
>>
stay safe and healthy
– the skint

Title: YOU’RE INVITED TO SCRAPPY READING SERIES (SPONSORED)

Content:
YOU’RE INVITED TO SCRAPPY READING SERIES (SPONSORED)
Five emerging and established writers will answer this question at this month’s edition of the
Scrappy Reading Series
, supported by the Red Hook Branch of the Brooklyn Public Library. Join us at
Compère Collective
as these writers share how they interpret “scrappy,” and how they embody this in their writing lives, personal lives, love lives, and any other type of life they are living. This month’s lineup includes:
Sienna Liu, Emily J. Smith, Brian Gresko, Sarah Kasbeer, and g.m. palmer
.
Also enjoy the exhibit by local artist, Lisett Clark-Dziedzic,
Openness
, which brings together a deeply personal and political narrative through works made from recycled materials, fabric collages, and photography. Rooted in the duality of two homes — New York and Chile — the exhibition weaves together themes of sustainability, migration, and identity.
Inspired by the master’s series course, “Scrappy: How To Build an Alternative Literary Life” (offered by
Off Assignment
and led by author
Chloé Caldwell
), Brooklyn writer
Farah Faye
began this series to bring together published and unpublished writers to explore what it means to be scrappy.
Admission is free, scrappiness required. Drinks and snacks will be served!
Space is limited –
register here to attend!
Scrappy Reading Series
Compére Collective
351 Van Brunt Street Brooklyn, NY 11231
Scrappy Reading Series is sponsored, in part, by the Greater New York Arts Development Fund of the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs, administered by Brooklyn Arts Council.

A dot-com billionaire pays an esteemed American theatre company to translate Shakespeare into English (Wait. What?). A sly comedy inspired by an unbelievably true story. To sell out or not to sell out—is that the question?

Title: TUES-THURS, 7/15-17: RESTAURANT WEEK RESERVATIONS, SHAKESPEARE IN THE PARKING LOT, CHELSEA + TRIBECA GALLERY WALK, AND MORE

Content:
TUES-THURS, 7/15-17: RESTAURANT WEEK RESERVATIONS, SHAKESPEARE IN THE PARKING LOT, CHELSEA + TRIBECA GALLERY WALK, AND MORE
tuesday
thru 8/29 (select tuesdays):
the sweat sessions
: strike a pose, throw a punch, or dance it out at the meatpacking district bid and wellth collective’s annual al fresco fitness series. 45-minute class options include yoga, boot camp, dance cardio, boxing, pilates, and more. b.y.o. mat. hudson river park’s 14th street park (10th ave bet 14th + 15th sts), free admission (rsvp).
>>
tues various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
despicable me 4
at stroud playground (crown heights)
>>
inside out 2
at pershing field park (jersey city)
>>
love is strange: romance shorts
at gansevoort plaza (meatpacking district)
>>
my big fat greek wedding
at pier 17 heineken riverdeck (lower manhattan)
>>
night at the museum
and
big
at domino park (williamsburg)
>>
tues (time tba):
summer restaurant week reservations become available today
: reservations open today for this season’s restaurant week (7/21–8/17), when hundreds of new york city restaurants roll out special prix-fixe lunches and dinners. full details, including the list of participating restaurants, will be posted on the new york city tourism website today.
>>
sponsored
: tues 5pm + 6:30pm:
wine tasting event at brookfield place
: celebrate summer by exploring a selection of wines on the waterfront during bfpl vineyard, an exclusive wine tasting event at brookfield place. connoisseurs and enthusiasts alike can indulge in a delightful experience that includes expertly curated wines, complimentary light bites, and waterfront views. attend with a friend or co-worker! each $50 ticket provides a reservation for a party of two (2 individuals). note that you must be 21+ to attend.
>>
tues 7pm (monthly):
brooklyn books + booze
: hear established and up-and-coming authors of different genres read from their current works every third tuesday of the month at barrow’s intense tasting room (industry city). tonight’s lineup features ilana c. myer, taran hunt, mike allen, and martin cahil. hosted by randee dawn. free admission.
>>
tues 7pm (monthly):
astronomy on tap: summer science blockbuster
: things are looking up at astronomy on tap, a night where astronomy enthusiasts gather at a local bar for talks by professional scientists and educators—plus themed games and other cosmic fun. tonight’s topics include ‘the new encounters in the milky way space show’ with dr. carter emmart and ‘the true history of a lizard and king kong’ with lauren vonnahme of the american museum of natural history. pete’s candy store (williamsburg), free admission.
>>
tues 7pm (monthly):
the broad squad
: kendra cunningham presents a monthly comedy variety show featuring a female heavy lineup. tonight’s performers: nonye brown-west, kimberly dinaro, myka fox, carrie gravenson, and tyrone thornhill. young ethel’s (south slope), free admission ($5 suggested donation).
>>
tues 7pm (+ 7/22):
jazz foundation presents: sunset sounds
: the jazz foundation of america presents a pair of sunset concerts on the hudson, featuring the eric person quintet (7/15) and axel tosca trio with xiomara laugart (7/22). pier i at 70th street, free admission.
>>
tues 7pm (tuesdays thru 8/17):
live at the gantries
: kupferberg center for the arts presents live at the gantries, an annual outdoor concert series at gantry plaza state park (lic) showcasing local artists. tonight: brooklyn based honky-tonk band the slide stops. free admission.
>>
sponsored
: tues 7:30pm:
defector media presents ten minute quarters: a wnba comedy show
: as we approach the wnba all-star break, join defector media and other wnba fans for a night of stand up, games, and giveaways. hosted by nora jefferies and jasper wang, and featuring devon walker, julia shiplett, grace johnson, and joey dardano. littlefield (gowanus), save 25% with promo code ‘skintwnba’
>>
tues 8pm (monthly):
animation nights new york
: watch a curated program of animated short films from around the world at this monthly screening event. the gutter spare room (williamsburg), pay-what-you-wish admission.
>>

weds thru sun (various dates thru 8/9):
lincoln center’s fourth annual summer for the city
: lincoln center’s annual arts festival brings two months of free and choose-what-you-pay music concerts, performances, dance parties, film screenings, and more to its upper west side campus. next up: brazil week—a week of concerts and cultural programs featuring latin grammy nominee melly, psychedelic rock band os mutantes, art-pop diva anelis assumpção, soul-samba singer liniker, and more.

:
a minecraft movie
at maria hernandez park (bushwick)
>>

at pier i in riverside park south (uws)

:

>>

>>
the wiz
at coffey park (red hook)
>>
weds (various times):
one flew over the cuckoo’s nest
50th anniversary screenings
: miloš forman’s 1975 academy award-winning drama/comedy, based on ken kesey’s 1962 novel and starring jack nicholson, louise fletcher, william redfield, danny devito, christopher lloyd, and will sampson, returns to select theaters for a limited engagement. various prices.
>>
weds 6pm (wednesdays thru 8/13):
summer concerts at hudson yards
: the annual concert series returns to the public square + gardens at hudson yards for eight weeks. tonight: rapper, singer and songwriter paul russell with an opening set by dj chachi. free admission.
>>
weds 6-8pm:
adaa chelsea + tribeca gallery walk
: the art dealers association of america’s annual art walk returns, expanding to include tribeca for a total of 58 galleries keeping their doors open for after-hours viewings, artist talks, walkthroughs, film screenings, and other special programming. free admission.
>>
weds 7pm (monthly):
adam wade: live in new york
: 20-time moth story slam winner adam wade returns to under st. marks theater with a storytelling show featuring three to four different stories from his extensive catalog (no two shows will be the same) and a different special guest who’ll kick things off. under st. marks theater (east village), sliding scale admission.
>>
weds 7pm:
speakeasy: ‘the definitive speechwriting comedy show’
: professional speechwriters and comedians are really into speeches talk about the techniques they love, the clichés they hate, and the written remarks that rocked their world. hosted by chandler dean and and sarah gruen. caveat (les), $15.67 adv with promo code ‘speakcheaply’ (reg. $24-25).
>>
weds 7pm (+ 7/23):
summer sounds! at carl schurz park
: steve shaiman and swingtime big band (tonight) and steel impressions caribbean band (7/23) return for this year’s summer sounds! concert series, presented by the carl schurz park conservancy at the elevated john finley walk (yorkville). free admission.
>>
weds 7:30pm:
we have fun: a stand-up show
: hosts zach sims and dan wilbur team up to bring the fun-ny to young ethel’s (south slope), with stand-up by peter grosz (npr), ariel elias (
kimmel
), sarah adelman (hbo), and joe briggs (
the boys are back
). free admission.
>>
weds 8pm:
ambush comedy show
: the ambush comedy show buzzes into hellrazor barber shop in williamsburg with a lineup featuring frank conniff (
mystery science theater 3000
), ariel elias (
fallon
), kunal arora (fx), kareem green (showtime), and sara bergmark (last laugh comedy). hosted by josh johnson, lucas connolly, and brittany cardwell. free admission.
>>
thursday
thurs thru 8/2 (thursdays-saturdays at 7pm):
shakespeare in the parking lot:
a midsummer night’s dream
: celebrating 30 years of free shakespeare productions in parking lots, the drilling company brings its adaptation of
a midsummer night’s dream
to the lower east side. chairs are first come, first served (or byo). 145 stanton street (entrance on suffolk street), free admission (donations welcome).
>>
thurs various times (weather permitting):
free outdoor movies
:
alien
at brooklyn bridge park – pier 1 harbor view lawn
>>
better man
at coney island beach at w 12th street
>>
folktales
at msgr. mcgolrick park (greenpoint)
>>
if
at st. gregory’s playground (uws)
>>
thurs 12:30pm (thursdays thru 7/31):
broadway in bryant park
: broadway comes to bryant park as stars perform some of their biggest hits at this annual lunchtime performance series. today:
chicago
,
death becomes her
,
gypsy
,
just in time
,
the book of mormon
, and
wicked
with a pre-show by the amda college of the performing arts. hosted by lite fm’s helen little. free admission.
>>
thurs 6pm (thursdays thru 7/31):
live at the archway: summer music + art in the dumbo archway
: sights and sounds fill the public plaza underneath the manhattan bridge in dumbo. tonight: afro-funksters kaleta + super yamba band and cara lee sparry. food and drink will be available for purchase. rain or shine. free admission.
>>
thurs 6:30pm (thursdays thru 7/31):
summer music series at bushwick inlet park
: soak up the sounds and skyline river sunset at the friends of bushwick inlet park’s fifth annual summer music series. tonight: ed martinez + conjunto sabor. 86 kent shoreline esplanade (williamsburg), free admission.
>>
thurs 6:30pm (thursdays thru 8/14):
sunset salsa
: dance into golden hour at hudson river park’s sunset salsa series, returning to pier 76 (midtown west) for the summer. led by performer and instructor talía castro-pozo, each night kicks off with a beginner salsa lesson—open to first-timers and seasoned dancers alike—followed by an open dance party with guest djs. free admission.
>>
thurs 7pm (monthly):
facts machine: science, comedy + trivia
: scientists and comedians share the stories behind their favorite facts, ‘conduct experiments’ (play drinking games), and probe their knowledge with a trivia challenge loosely inspired by tonight’s theme: flowers. hosted by scientists and pub trivia hosts em costa, noah guiberson, and rob frawley. caveat (les), $13.61 with promo code ‘theskint’ (reg. $24-$25).
>>
thurs 7pm (+ 7/20, 8/7, 8/14, 8/28):
the queens jazz trail concert series
: inspired by the queens jazz trail map highlighting the homes of jazz legends, the annual the queens jazz trail concert series presents seven free jazz concerts in queens parks. tonight: rubén coca quintet at rockaway beach park.
>>
thurs 7-11pm:
pancakes + booze art show
: the pancakes + booze pop-up art show serves up a feast for your eyes—and your belly—taking over brooklyn monarch with works by more than 150 local artists, music, and all-you-can-eat pancakes. brooklyn monarch (east williamsburg), $20.
>>
thurs 7pm doors (thursdays thru 7/31):
river + blues concert series
: settle in for sunset sounds at nelson a. rockefeller park, where the annual river + blues concert series brings global and american folk, roots, and blues artists to the waterfront. bring a blanket or lawn chair, pack a picnic (or purchase snacks and drinks on-site), and enjoy the music with hudson river views. tonight: singer-songwriter amythyst kiah with opener dj reagonomics. free admission.
>>
thurs 7:30pm (thursdays thru 7/31):
astoria park concert series
: central astoria ldc’s annual concert series returns with four nights of live music on the ditmars side lawn at astoria park. tonight: gentlemen of soul (1970s-2000s soul and r+b hits). free admission.
>>
thurs 8pm (+ 7/20 3pm):
resounding silents: live-scored surrealist silent shorts
: the resounding silents film series presents a screening of surrealist short films from the 1920s-40s, accompanied by an original, live score performed by singer-songwriter ally brown, michael lucarelli, and anthime miller. the living gallery (bushwick), $15.
>>
thurs 8pm (monthly):
twilight
entirely from memory
: watch as blindly-cast ten bones theatre company performers attempt to recreate
twilight
(2008)—without the help of scripts or rehearsals. as chaos ensues, drinks are drunk while the players are challenged to incorporate lines written by the audience and create ‘deleted’ scenes. littlefield (gowanus), $12 adv, $14 day of.
>>
thurs 10pm:
taking back thursday: the only girl run emo vs nü metal night
: dance and sing/scream/cry the night away at dj k styles and kayte’s taking back thursday emo vs nü metal party. arlene’s grocery (les), free admission.
>>
ongoing
our roundup of 70+ ongoing events and attractions
: public beaches and pools,
sargent and paris
, free outdoor fitness classes, and more.
>>
stay safe and healthy
– the skint
